uima.wikipedia.parser
Class MWDumpReader

java.lang.Object
  uima.wikipedia.parser.MWDumpReader
Direct Known Subclasses:
MWDumpReaderFactory.MWDumpReaderLatestOnly
public class MWDumpReader
extends java.lang.Object

This class is the core of the Collection reader component. It's dedicated to extract the relevant data from the XML stream. I tried to keep things as simple and robust as possible.

I make use of the StAX API to provide a pull-parsing style parser. The basic unit you can get from that parser is a page, also known as an article. You can also get the Siteinfo information (especially the namespaces) if it's present.

You can get an instance of this parser with the MWDumpReaderFactory. This factory also allows you to place various filters on the XML stream to exclude or include only certain pages or revisions.

Author:
Maxime Bury <Maxime.bury@gmail.com>
See Also:
MWSiteinfo, MWArticle, MWRevision

Constructor Detail

MWDumpReader

public MWDumpReader(javax.xml.stream.XMLStreamReader reader)
             throws MWDumpReader.MWParseException
Initializes the parser. In particular, it skips a few unuseful blocks at the beginning and tries to compute the Siteinfo right away. It also initializes the data factories.

Parameters:
reader - An XML stream reader from which we get the data
Throws:
MWDumpReader.MWParseException - Exception is thrown if the underlying XML document is malformed.
Method Detail

getPage

public MWArticle getPage()
This method returns the last computed page. It should only be used after a successful call to the hasPage() method.

Returns:
the last computed page
See Also:
MWArticle

getSiteInfo

public MWSiteinfo getSiteInfo()
This method return the site info (containing namespaces in particular). It should only be used after a successful call to hasSiteInfo(). Otherwise, the fields of the returned object will have a default value.

Returns:
the site info
See Also:
MWSiteinfo

hasSiteInfo

public final boolean hasSiteInfo()
A successful call to this method ensures you that a call to getSiteInfo() will return relevant information.

Returns:
true if the parser has managed to compute the site info; false otherwise.

hasPage

public final boolean hasPage()
A successful call to this method ensures you that a call to getPage() will succeed as well. The parser tries to compute a page, taking in account the filters, until it succeeds to compute one or reaches the end of the document.

Returns:
true if the parser has managed to compute a page; false otherwise.

close

public final void close()
Use this method to free the ressources the parser was using (meaning the XML stream) in a clean way.

Throws:
javax.xml.stream.XMLStreamException - If the XML stream fails to be closed.

computePage

private final boolean computePage()
                           throws MWDumpReader.MWParseException
This method is normally called only if a call to hasPage() succeeded. It returns true when the parsing of the page is successful, meaning no malformation were encountered and at least one revision was kept. It returns false otherwise.

Returns:
true on the successful parsing of a page, false otherwise.
Throws:
MWDumpReader.MWParseException - If a malformation is encountered in the underlying XML stream

computeRevision

private final void computeRevision()
                            throws java.util.NoSuchElementException,
                                   javax.xml.stream.XMLStreamException
This is where we get the actually interresting data. The revisions hold the text data. It functions in a very similar fashion as the computePage() method. Each successfuly parsed revision is added to the article's list of revisions.

Throws:
java.util.NoSuchElementException
javax.xml.stream.XMLStreamException - If something goes wrong, catched by the computePage() method.

computeSiteInfo

private final void computeSiteInfo()
                            throws MWDumpReader.MWParseException
Process the site info. In particular we gather the namespaces and the associated indexes.

Throws:
MWDumpReader.MWParseException

nextOpeningTag

private final void nextOpeningTag(int n)
                           throws javax.xml.stream.XMLStreamException,
                                  java.util.NoSuchElementException
Places the cursor on the nth opening tag following the current cursor position.

Parameters:
n - the number of tags to skip
Throws:
javax.xml.stream.XMLStreamException - If encountering a malformation in the underlying XML document.
java.util.NoSuchElementException - If the parser reaches the end of the document unexpectedly

skipThisTag

private final void skipThisTag()
                        throws javax.xml.stream.XMLStreamException
Places the cursor on the ending tag corresponding to the current opening tag.

Throws:
javax.xml.stream.XMLStreamException - If encountering a malformation in the underlying XML document.

getTagText

private final java.lang.String getTagText()
                                   throws javax.xml.stream.XMLStreamException

Returns the text following the current XML opening tag. This method can be called only when the cursor is on an opening tag.

If the current tag is immediately closed (contains no text), the empty string is returned. Throws an exception if the document ends unexpectedly (this should not happen if the document is well formed)

Example : <myOpeningTag> Will return this text </myOpeningTag>

Returns:
the text following the current opening tag
Throws:
javax.xml.stream.XMLStreamException - If encountering a malformation in the underlying XML document.
